title: UPDATE: ConocoPhillips profit tops estimates, to offer 10-year capital plan at Nov. analyst day
text: ConocoPhillips COP, +1.75% said Tuesday it had net income of $3.1 billion, or $2.74 a share, in the third quarter, up from $1.9 billion, or $1.59 per share, in the year-earlier period. Excluding special items, EPS came to 82 cents a share, ahead of the 72 cents FactSet consensus. The company did not offer a revenue figure in its earnings release, but a regulatory filing disclosed revenue of $7.756 billion for the quarter, below the $9.449 billion posted a year ago and the $7.923 billion consensus. The company said production excluding Libya came to 1,322 thousand barrels of oil equivalent a day, up 98 MBOED from a year ago. Chief Executive Ryan Lance said at a November analyst meeting, that will outline plans for free cash flow generation with competitive returns on capital and returns of capital. The company is expecting fourth-quarter production excluding Libya of 1,265 to 1,305 MBOED. Shares rose 1.1% premarket, but are down 11% in 2019, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.24% has gained 21%.
